communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all police reports made between November 1, 2022 and June 19, 2024 that involve incidents occurred at the 2000 Block of Windbreak Lane, Lansing MI and 2100 Block of Forest Road, Lansing MI and/or include the name Kornelius Friske.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Livingston

title: Suicide in the Military (Defense Manpower Data Center)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am seeking additional information about suicide in the military beyond what is presented in the attached 2022 Annual Report on Suicide in the Military.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the years 2015-2023:
1) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state;
2) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state and means;
3) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by state and means and precise location (private residence, barracks, etc);
4) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility;
5) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility and means;
6) the number of suicides of military service members (active duty, reserve, national guard, and military family members) by facility and means and precise location (private residence, barracks, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Burd-Sharps
Kathryn Fingar
Mackey O'Keefe
Paige Tetens

title: ATF support for 2008-2014 series "Sons of Anarchy"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ATF support for 2008-2014 series "Sons of Anarchy"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

ll documents pertaining to collaboration between the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) and the production of the 2008-2014 FX series "Sons of Anarchy." Such documents may include, but should not be not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the ATF and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Sons of Anarchy," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: CIA support for 2024 film "My Spy: The Eternal City"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA support for 2024 film "My Spy: The Eternal City"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and the production of the 2024 movie "My Spy: The Eternal City," directed by Peter Segal and starring Dave Bautista. Such documents may include, but should not be not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; production stills; and all records of communications between employees of the CIA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "My Spy: The Eternal City," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication

I would also like to know if the CIA provided any form of support or technical advice whatsoever to the production of "My Spy: The Eternal City" or to any member of the cast or crew, or if the production or any member of the cast or crew sought assistance from the CIA in connection with the production of the film.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: CSCA Master List (U.S. Department of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Country Signing Certificate Authority (CSCA) Master List currently in use, containing the root and intermediate CA certificates used to verify the digital signatures in biometric passports. These certificates are obtained via ICAO-PKD and bilateral exchanges and used by software that verifies passports.

As an example, Germany provides their list here: https://www.bsi.bund.de/SharedDocs/Downloads/DE/BSI/ElekAusweise/CSCA/GermanMasterList.html

Please provide this list in the original source format, eg. .ML, .LDIF, .PEM, or .CRT.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FEC complaints against trump
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All complaints filed with the Federal Election Commission alleging contribution limit violations by Donald Trump, his campaign committees, or affiliated political action committees from January 1 2024 up to the date this request is processed. 

2. Any documents related to FEC investigations or enforcement actions stemming from such complaints during the same period.

3. A summary of the number and nature of such complaints received in 2024, if available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriel Garcia

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request to the Federal Election Commission FOIA (2024-253)
communications.communication:
Dear Mrs. Garcia,

This email acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated August 5, 2024.

Specifically, you requested the following:

“1. All complaints filed with the Federal Election Commission alleging contribution limit violations by Donald Trump, his campaign committees, or affiliated political action committees from January 1 2024 up to the date this request is processed.
2. Any documents related to FEC investigations or enforcement actions stemming from such complaints during the same period.
3. A summary of the number and nature of such complaints received in 2024, if available.”

We received your request on August 6, 2024.

We will soon be initiating our search for records responsive to your request.  If we determine that you have requested a voluminous amount of records that require extensive searching and examination, we will contact you to discuss your willingness to modify your request.

Any questions regarding the status of this request should be directed to our office at foia@fec.gov or 202-694-1650.  Please cite the following unique tracking number in all future correspondence regarding this matter: FOIA Request 2024-253.

Thank you for contacting the Federal Election Commission.

Sincerely,

Christopher Mealy
FEC FOIA Requester Service Center

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear J publi, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded. 
 
Please click here to visit our (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXT2aAhmhBYiUcSShAuSz-2Fsuc8QsVv36mciHGQCY-2FePauA1sn_TeR2p7Fkes0S-2B6Rwq4Oca0G2l8zp1hGd-2FmiwXHPbTFM1hJSRD5xI4zjZewwd7L9sqWxE9fyX4tNjkYfS5mNBt3Qcc-2FNpIFl-2Bm3ORlo-2BumxJjnWhX3khSSjEJcj-2FkCnKje-2BBOHM1b7zNOJ-2B88CO-2FaZ-2B-2BMsM-2BHK1Yv4VmFpFufaNON5dcnoYxr30vdwoWtEl5Q-2Fzdwqahomks80-2FBWvKfpE8eag33JUZ5kx4ao595B7ZM-3D) Chicago Public Records portal! (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXT2aAhmhBYiUcSShAuSz-2Fsuc8QsVv36mciHGQCY-2FePau0TXc_TeR2p7Fkes0S-2B6Rwq4Oca0G2l8zp1hGd-2FmiwXHPbTFM1hJSRD5xI4zjZewwd7L9sqWxE9fyX4tNjkYfS5mNBt-2Fmi1rEw77j-2FPRTQ1OUgck7R-2FCnIDVMGaQ-2BSlOPNmYB5d4DwrA1dqV5hrUk9B-2BVHQzbbyzMCaDxLghkzykYFqqzDjMV3pJD9cLTFzNnwSmmIPwYxx2J-2FTRGB9hUZwakzB0Zyp1XGwt8MQKqZ-2BUCjzRc-3D) 
 Login: 171099-69666401@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, please request a Temporary Password using the Forgot Password option on the login screen. 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, and Lynn Mccarthy for 2021 to the General Consul at that time.

All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, and Lynn Mccarthy for 2022 to the General Consul at that time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

J publi

Chicago Police Department (CPD) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial Police FOIA Request :: P968994-080524
communications.communication:
--- --- 

08/05/2024 
HICAGO OLICE EPARTMENT 
CITY OF CHICAGO 
J publi 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR171099 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 
RE: FOIA REQUEST of August 05, 2024, Reference # P968994-080524 
Dear J: 
The Chicago Police Department is in receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request. On August 05, 2024, the following request was received. To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

All emails from Kim Foxx, risa Lanier and Lynn Mccarthy for 2020 to David Brown, former superintendent. 

All emails from Kim Foxx, risa Lanier and Lynn Mccarthy for 2021 to David Brown, former superintendent. 

All emails from Kim Foxx, risa Lanier and Lynn Mccarthy for 2022 to David Brown, former superintendent. 

All emails All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, and Lynn Mccarthy for 2020 to the former chief of BIA 

All emails All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, and Lynn Mccarthy for 2021 to the former chief of BIA 

All emails All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, or Lynn Mccarthy for 2022 to the former chief of BIA. 

All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, and Lynn Mccarthy for 2020 to the General Consul at that time. 

All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, and Lynn Mccarthy for 2021 to the General Consul at that time. 

All emails from Kim Foxx, Risa Lanier, and Lynn Mccarthy for 2022 to the General Consul at that time. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

J publi 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-police-department-503%252Femail-requests-171099%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540chicagopolice.org&url_auth_token=AAAjxjMtpIpF_W_lFWW9xxGvJO8%3A1sb9aW%3Ape_J3g7SmgIUgjONXnD54SseE5mjFqDgORZsx9234Sc 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for the following reason(s): 
The request may require the collection of a substantial number of specified records, if any exist; 
The requested records, if any exist, may require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of the Freedom of Information Act or should be 
If you have any questions, please contact our office at 312-745-5308 or at the following address: Chicago Police Department Attention: Freedom of Information Officer Office of Legal Affairs, Unit 114 3510 S. Michigan Ave. Chicago, IL 60653 
Sincerely, Robert Earnshaw 
Freedom of Information Officer 
Chicago Police Department

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities, including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. This may be one document with many policies, or all policies collected.

The original format of the documents is acceptable (PDF, .doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Barr

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy Documents
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for submitting your request for documents.

I should clarify that the Borough of East Pittsburgh disbanded its police department as of November 30, 2018.

The Borough recently signed a charter agreement with North Braddock Borough and Rankin Borough to form the Eastern Regional Mon Valley Police Department.

Policies for the organization are kept in the headquarters located at 600 Anderson St., North Braddock, PA 15104.

You can reach the office at https://ermvpd.org or you can call the office at 412-351-4900.




Respectfully,

Benjamin D. Walker
412-823-7124x108
bwalker@eastpittsburghboro.com<mailto:bwalker@eastpittsburghboro.com>
Borough Manager
Borough of East Pittsburgh

files.title: ~WRD0001
files.source: East Pittsburgh Police Department, East Pittsburgh, PA

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: TN Applications for Clemency
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all applications for clemency reviewed by the Tennessee Department of Corrections (TDOC) for offenses committed before 09/01/2020 pursuant to the Drug-Free School Zone Act (Public Chapter 803 (2020), Tenn. Code Ann. 39-17-432). These applications should be those sent by inmates to be considered for commutation by the governor.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Jenny Wadhwa.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Barr

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy documents
communications.communication:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Barr

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: William Calley
communications.communication:
Dear Department of the Army:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. Please produce all records related to William Laws Calley Jr. Mr. Calley was born on June 8, 1943, in Miami, Florida, USA and died on April 8, 2024. Mr. Calley was a junior Army officer and held the rank of second lieutenant. He was the only person convicted in connection with the My Lai Massacre of 1968 during the Vietnam War.

PROOF OF DEATH:

Mr. Calley's news obituary from the Washington Post is attached.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH:

In addition to your standard search practices, please also search your files regarding the My Lai Massacre to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Calley.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that you produce responsive records electronically, by email attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

Thank you very much.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Auto Reply: Your message has been received
communications.communication:
Your inquiry has been received by the US Army Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) office.

Thank you for contacting us.

Army FOIA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: James Scott
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear CIA:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. Please produce all records related to James Campbell Scott. Dr. Scott was born in Mount Holly, New Jersey, USA on December 2, 1936 and died on July 19, 2024. A news obituary from the Washington Post (attached) notes the Agency’s interest in Dr. Scott and his writings.

PROOF OF DEATH:

Dr. Scott's news obituary from the Washington Post is attached.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that you produce responsive records electronically, by email attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

Thank you very much.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.
